ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A comprehensive overview over microeconomics. As equal time is spend on each topic some harder topics are very hard and easier topics are even easier.
Yes. I would recommend Econ 501 to another student.
A good class but required lots of work.

It is a very theoretical course that builds strong basis for future economic research. If you feel that your quantitative skills are not really strong then I would discourage you to attend the course.However, if you're looking for a challenge and you're interested in economic research, then this is the perfect fit for you.
very interesting material, very well taught, the material covered is very important in economics in general
You have to take it. It makes a person like me who wasn't going to do any micro thinking about it.
Very interesting, if interested in theory. But heavy workload.
It's necessary for an econ PhD student.
NA-a compulsory course
Yes as a department requirement for Econ or Finance.
Sure! Definitely necessary for econ PhDs.
Yes I would recommend the class.

I would recommend the course to other Economics Phd students but not to other students, since the things that are taught are mainly of relevance to economics modelling and only partially relevant for other things
Rquired course of 1st year econ students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think it helped me quite a lot. Not only it provided me with a set of tools to tackle economic problems but it also equipped me with a framework to analyze the interaction of economic agents.
deepened my understanding of microeconomics and will be helpful in understanding economic research in general
It definitely broaden my horizon.
Relevant tools and insights, also for people not necessarily interested in theory...
This is not so helpful on my research, but I understand that this course contributes to my theoretical background for future research.
I think! Hard to tell so far.
